titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Information Services, Archives and Records Retention, Office Files of Gloria Walters
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Information Services, Archives and Records Retention, Office Files of Gloria Walters FA1729

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-10-01 04:55:47 UTC.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Information Services, Archives and Records Retention, Office Files of Gloria Walters

physdesc.extent: 9 document boxes: 6 letter boxes; 2 legal boxes; and 1 half-letter box

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Ford Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection contains the office files that Gloria Walters created when she served as Archivist/Records Retention Manager at the Ford Foundation and was based in the Foundation's Information Services, Archives and Records Retention unit. The collection is comprised of 3 series. The first series, Subject files, documents Walters' general activities in leading the Foundation's archives and records retention functions and supporting the larger Information Services department, primarily between 1993 and 1996, whereas the second series, Automation project files, specifically concerns the archive's automation project. Files in the third series, Researcher files, were removed from the Subject files series during processing and closed to access because of concerns over the privacy of the Foundation archive's researchers.
Common material formats found throughout the collection include correspondence, notes, drafts, reports, publications, meeting agendas, and charts.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at the RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files, and officers' papers were transferred to and accessioned by the RAC beginning in 2011.
This material was transferred to the RAC in 2019 in two different sets of records and was ingested by the RAC as Accession 2019:111 and Accession 2019:112.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gloria Walters' general activities for leading the Ford Foundation's archives and records retention unit and supporting the larger Information Services department are documented within this series. The files largely concern topics like archives and records retention policies and workflows, transfers of materials to the archive, communication with the Foundation's field offices, microfilming of archival materials, the Central Index for the Foundation's grant records, the automation project, and the archives and records retention unit's administration.

Part of Walters' responsibilities for developing, disseminating, and enacting the Foundation's archives and records retention policies and workflows included introducing and reviewing the policies with Foundation staff and Program Officer orientations. The communication between the Foundation archive and field offices documented within the files primarily pertains to the transferring to the archive and microfilming of closed grant records. Regarding the archive's automation project, the series includes documentation of Walters' role in searching for a consultant to review the archive's holdings, descriptive data, systems, and procedures and to develop a plan for automation. Further information on the automation project can be found in the collection's second series.

Walters' administrative responsibilities documented within the series include budgeting and gathering and submitting statistics for the archives and records retention unit. Statistics reports relating to archive researchers have been relocated to the end of the series and closed to access because of privacy concerns. Similarly, files pertaining to the archive's reference work with researchers were removed and processed into series 3 which is also restricted from access.

did.unittitle: Field Offices - Nairobi, Kenya and Harare, Zimbabwe
Field Office - Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials in this series document Ford Foundation Archives and Records Retention Manager Gloria Walter's work on the archive's automation project. They concern pre-automation tasks the Archives and Records Retention unit staff needed to perform, cataloging, databases, the grants records Central Index, and the Information Services department investigating and contracting different systems and software vendors for the automation project.
